locuaz

Mutation Creator

locuaz.mutationcreation

class locuaz.mutationcreation.MutationCreator(top_branches: Dict[str, Branch], branches: int, creation_config: Dict[str, Any], *, excluded_sites: Set[int], amber_numbering: bool = False, logger: Logger)[source]

Bases: Mapping

MutationCreator creates mutations by

  • choosing 1 or more positions after discarding the excluded ones and optionally discarding those that are not interfacing with the target.

  • optionally splits amino acids into user-defined bins. Then chooses the bin of the current residue (‘within’) or any of the other ones (‘exclude’).

  • within the potential amino acids, it chooses one of them following a uniform distribution (‘uniform’), Reis&Barletta distribution (‘ReisBarletta’) or a custom user-defined probability (‘custom’)

For each position, the chosen amino acid will be discarded from future consideration. This also applies to bins. If all bins were discarded and more mutations were asked for, the bins are reset but not the potential amino acids.

aa_selector: AminoAcidSelector
mutations: Dict[str, List[Mutation]]
site_selector: SiteSelector
